lines.content: * This class represents Shagbot, which is a chatbot program.
* The Shagbot class serves as the main starting point to run the chatbot. It initialises
* essential classes such as the UI, TaskList, Parser and Storage Classes.
* This class also handles the main execution loop for user interaction with Shagbot.
* Constructor for the {@code Shagbot} class with its specified chatbot name.
* Initialises the Ui, taskList, parser and storage objects.
* It also loads any previously saved tasks from the specified file.
* @param name The name of the chatbot.

* This exception is thrown to indicate errors specific to {@link shagbot.Shagbot} operations.
* @param message Error message displayed for exceptions.

* @param dateTimeStr The string representation of date and time.
* @return The parsed {@link LocalDateTime} object representing the deadline.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if provided date or time is invalid.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format. Please use 'd/M/yyyy HHmm'.");
* Retrieves the date and time associated with the task.
* @return The {@link LocalDateTime} object representing the task's deadline.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Deadline} task.
* The format includes the task type "[D]", the description from the
* parent {@link Task} class, and the date and timing of the deadline.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline Task.
* Constructor for the {@code Event} class with the specified description of event,
* start timing and end timing of the event.
* @param desc  The description of the task.
* @param start The start time of the event.
* @param end   The end time of the event.
public Event(String desc, String start, String end) {

assertEquals(3, tasks.length, "Task list should contain 3 tasks after deletion");
assertEquals(task1, tasks[0], "First task should be Task 1");
assertEquals(task4, tasks[2], "Third task should be Task 4");
assertEquals(task1, taskList.getTask(0), "Task at index 0 should be Task 1");
assertEquals(task2, taskList.getTask(1), "Task at index 1 should be Task 2");
assertEquals(task3, taskList.getTask(2), "Task at index 2 should be Task 3");
assertEquals(task4, taskList.getTask(3), "Task at index 3 should be Task 4");
assertFalse(taskList.getTask(0).isDone(), "Task 1 should be unmarked as not done");
assertTrue(taskList.getTask(1).isDone(), "Task 2 should be marked as done");
assertTrue(taskList.getTask(2).isDone(), "Task 3 should be marked as done");
assertFalse(taskList.getTask(3).isDone(), "Task 4 should be unmarked as not done");
